intro: Anemonoides trifolia subsp. trifolia, commonly known as the three-leaved anemonoid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves composed of three oval to lance-shaped leaflets. The plant produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers with five petals, blooming in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported diuretic and anti-inflammatory properties.
